trans-unit.source: How to: Use ACS Management Service to Configure Facebook as an Internet Identity Provider
trans-unit.target: How to: Use ACS Management Service to Configure Facebook as an Internet Identity Provider

trans-unit.source: Azure
trans-unit.target: Azure

trans-unit.source: How to: Use ACS Management Service to Configure Facebook as an Internet Identity Provider
trans-unit.target: How to: Use ACS Management Service to Configure Facebook as an Internet Identity Provider

trans-unit.source: Applies To
trans-unit.target: Applies To

trans-unit.source: Microsoft® Azure™ Access Control Service (ACS)
trans-unit.target: Microsoft® Azure™ Access Control Service (ACS)

trans-unit.source: Facebook
trans-unit.target: Facebook

trans-unit.source: Summary
trans-unit.target: Summary

trans-unit.source: This topic outlines the basic steps required for adding Facebook as an identity provider.
trans-unit.target: This topic outlines the basic steps required for adding Facebook as an identity provider.

trans-unit.source: Facebook can be added as an identity provider to <token>secondref_acs</token> using the Management Portal or it can be automated with the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service.
trans-unit.target: Facebook can be added as an identity provider to <token>secondref_acs</token> using the Management Portal or it can be automated with the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service.

trans-unit.source: Working with the Management Service is useful, for example, in scenarios when you are building a custom user interface for managing <token>secondref_acs</token> or when automating the onboarding of a new tenant for multi-tenant Software as a Service (SaaS) solutions.
trans-unit.target: Working with the Management Service is useful, for example, in scenarios when you are building a custom user interface for managing <token>secondref_acs</token> or when automating the onboarding of a new tenant for multi-tenant Software as a Service (SaaS) solutions.

trans-unit.target: List the steps required to add Facebook as an identity provider.

trans-unit.source: Test that the configuration is successful.
trans-unit.target: Test that the configuration is successful.

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: Management Service is a web service that is one of the key components of <token>secondref_acs</token>.
trans-unit.target: Management Service is a web service that is one of the key components of <token>secondref_acs</token>.

trans-unit.source: The Management Service exposes functionality that is available via the Management Portal user interface.
trans-unit.target: The Management Service exposes functionality that is available via the Management Portal user interface.

trans-unit.source: Anything that can be accomplished in the Management Portal can also be done using the Management Service.
trans-unit.target: Anything that can be accomplished in the Management Portal can also be done using the Management Service.

trans-unit.source: Adding Facebook as an identity provider to <token>secondref_acs</token> allows you to save on developing and maintaining the identity management mechanism of Internet scale.
trans-unit.target: Adding Facebook as an identity provider to <token>secondref_acs</token> allows you to save on developing and maintaining the identity management mechanism of Internet scale.

trans-unit.source: To accomplish the task of configuring Facebook as identity provider, you need to write code that follows specific steps.
trans-unit.target: To accomplish the task of configuring Facebook as identity provider, you need to write code that follows specific steps.

trans-unit.source: This topic outlines these basic steps.
trans-unit.target: This topic outlines these basic steps.

trans-unit.source: Summary of Steps
trans-unit.target: Summary of Steps

trans-unit.source: Step 1 – Collect Configuration Information
trans-unit.target: Step 1 – Collect Configuration Information

trans-unit.source: Step 2 – Add References to the Required Services and Assemblies
trans-unit.target: Step 2 – Add References to the Required Services and Assemblies

trans-unit.source: Step 3 – Implement the Management Service Proxy
trans-unit.target: Step 3 – Implement the Management Service Proxy

trans-unit.source: Step 4 – Add an Identity Provider
trans-unit.target: Step 4 – Add an Identity Provider

trans-unit.source: Step 5 – Test Your Work
trans-unit.target: Step 5 – Test Your Work

trans-unit.source: Step 1 – Collect Configuration Information
trans-unit.target: Step 1 – Collect Configuration Information

trans-unit.source: This step identifies and shows how to collect the required configuration information.
trans-unit.target: This step identifies and shows how to collect the required configuration information.

trans-unit.source: You need to collect the following information:
trans-unit.target: You need to collect the following information:

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Management Service identity username</embeddedLabel>—<ui>ManagementClient</ui>.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Management Service identity username</embeddedLabel>—<ui>ManagementClient</ui>.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Management Service identity password</embeddedLabel>—To obtain the service identity password for the management service:
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Management Service identity password</embeddedLabel>—To obtain the service identity password for the management service:

trans-unit.source: Log on to the Access Control Service Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: Log on to the Access Control Service Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Administration</ui> section, click the <ui>Management Service</ui> link.
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Administration</ui> section, click the <ui>Management Service</ui> link.

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Management Service</ui> page, click the <ui>ManagementClient</ui> link (<ui>ManagementClient</ui> is the actual username for the service).
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Management Service</ui> page, click the <ui>ManagementClient</ui> link (<ui>ManagementClient</ui> is the actual username for the service).

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Credentials</ui> section, click either the <ui>Symmetric Key</ui> or the <ui>Password</ui> link.
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Credentials</ui> section, click either the <ui>Symmetric Key</ui> or the <ui>Password</ui> link.

trans-unit.source: The value in each is the same.
trans-unit.target: The value in each is the same.

trans-unit.source: This is the password.
trans-unit.target: This is the password.

trans-unit.source: Your service’s namespace
trans-unit.target: Your service’s namespace

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>ACS hostname</embeddedLabel>—Usually <ui>accesscontrol.windows.net.</ui>
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>ACS hostname</embeddedLabel>—Usually <ui>accesscontrol.windows.net.</ui>

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Facebook Application ID and Application Secret</embeddedLabel>—Follow the instructions in <link xlink:href="749745a9-7b9c-455b-a2c6-575724ba4ea0" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How To: Configure Facebook as an Identity Provider</link>.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Facebook Application ID and Application Secret</embeddedLabel>—Follow the instructions in <link xlink:href="749745a9-7b9c-455b-a2c6-575724ba4ea0" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How To: Configure Facebook as an Identity Provider</link>.

trans-unit.source: After collecting the required information, follow these steps to create a sample console application that will run the code for adding Facebook as an identity provider:
trans-unit.target: After collecting the required information, follow these steps to create a sample console application that will run the code for adding Facebook as an identity provider:

trans-unit.source: Open Visual Studio® 2010 and create a new console application project.
trans-unit.target: Open Visual Studio® 2010 and create a new console application project.

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Program</ui> class, assign the information collected earlier to the module scope variables, using code similar to the following.
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Program</ui> class, assign the information collected earlier to the module scope variables, using code similar to the following.

trans-unit.source: Step 2 – Add References to the Required Services and Assemblies
trans-unit.target: Step 2 – Add References to the Required Services and Assemblies

trans-unit.source: This step identifies and adds the required dependencies to the services and assemblies.
trans-unit.target: This step identifies and adds the required dependencies to the services and assemblies.

trans-unit.source: To add the required dependencies to the services and assemblies
trans-unit.target: To add the required dependencies to the services and assemblies

trans-unit.source: Add a reference to System.Web.Extensions.
trans-unit.target: Add a reference to System.Web.Extensions.

trans-unit.source: Add a service reference to the Management Service.
trans-unit.target: Add a service reference to the Management Service.

trans-unit.source: The Management Service URL is unique to your namespace and looks similar to the following:
trans-unit.target: The Management Service URL is unique to your namespace and looks similar to the following:

trans-unit.source: https://<placeholder>YOURNAMESPACE</placeholder>.accesscontrol.windows.net/v2/mgmt/service
trans-unit.target: https://<placeholder>YOURNAMESPACE</placeholder>.accesscontrol.windows.net/v2/mgmt/service

trans-unit.source: Add the following declarations.
trans-unit.target: Add the following declarations.

trans-unit.source: Notice the last declaration, <ui>ConsoleApplication1.ServiceReference1</ui>, it may vary in your case if you changed default values when creating your console application or when adding the reference to the management service.
trans-unit.target: Notice the last declaration, <ui>ConsoleApplication1.ServiceReference1</ui>, it may vary in your case if you changed default values when creating your console application or when adding the reference to the management service.

trans-unit.source: Step 3 – Implement the Management Service Proxy
trans-unit.target: Step 3 – Implement the Management Service Proxy

trans-unit.source: This step creates a method that encapsulates the implementation of the Management Service proxy.
trans-unit.target: This step creates a method that encapsulates the implementation of the Management Service proxy.

trans-unit.source: To implement the Management Service proxy
trans-unit.target: To implement the Management Service proxy

trans-unit.source: Add the following method to the <ui>Program</ui> class.
trans-unit.target: Add the following method to the <ui>Program</ui> class.

trans-unit.source: Implement the <ui>GetTokenWithWritePermission</ui> method and its helper methods.
trans-unit.target: Implement the <ui>GetTokenWithWritePermission</ui> method and its helper methods.

trans-unit.source: It will add the SWT OAuth token to the Authorization header of the HTTP request.
trans-unit.target: It will add the SWT OAuth token to the Authorization header of the HTTP request.

trans-unit.source: Step 4 – Add an Identity Provider
trans-unit.target: Step 4 – Add an Identity Provider

trans-unit.source: This step adds Facebook as an identity provider using the Management Service proxy you created earlier.
trans-unit.target: This step adds Facebook as an identity provider using the Management Service proxy you created earlier.

trans-unit.source: To add Facebook as an identity provider
trans-unit.target: To add Facebook as an identity provider

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Main</ui> method initialize the Management Service proxy.
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Main</ui> method initialize the Management Service proxy.

trans-unit.source: Add your identity provider as the issuer.
trans-unit.target: Add your identity provider as the issuer.

trans-unit.source: Create an identity provider.
trans-unit.target: Create an identity provider.

trans-unit.source: Create an identity provider signing key based on the certificate you obtained earlier.
trans-unit.target: Create an identity provider signing key based on the certificate you obtained earlier.

trans-unit.source: Make the identity provider available to relying parties, except the Management Service.
trans-unit.target: Make the identity provider available to relying parties, except the Management Service.

trans-unit.source: Step 5 – Test Your Work
trans-unit.target: Step 5 – Test Your Work

trans-unit.source: To test your work
trans-unit.target: To test your work

trans-unit.source: Log on to the Access Control Service Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: Log on to the Access Control Service Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Access Control Service</ui> page, click the <ui>Rule Groups</ui> link in the <ui>Trust Relationships</ui> section.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Access Control Service</ui> page, click the <ui>Rule Groups</ui> link in the <ui>Trust Relationships</ui> section.

trans-unit.source: Click any of the available rules.
trans-unit.target: Click any of the available rules.

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Edit Rule Group</ui> page, click the <ui>Add Rule</ui> link.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Edit Rule Group</ui> page, click the <ui>Add Rule</ui> link.

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Add Claim Rule</ui> page, choose the newly added identity provider from the drop-down list in the <ui>Claim Issuer</ui> section.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Add Claim Rule</ui> page, choose the newly added identity provider from the drop-down list in the <ui>Claim Issuer</ui> section.

trans-unit.source: Leave the rest of the default values.
trans-unit.target: Leave the rest of the default values.

trans-unit.source: Click <ui>Save</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Click <ui>Save</ui>.

trans-unit.source: You have just created a pass-through rule for the identity provider.
trans-unit.target: You have just created a pass-through rule for the identity provider.
